title: Rutgers center Myles Johnson enters name in transfer portal
body: Rutgers center Myles Johnson (15) gestures against Ohio State during an NCAA college basketball game, Saturday, Jan. 9, 2021, in Piscataway, N.J. junior center  entered his name into the transfer portal, he announced in a tweet on Thursday.The news comes four days following Rutgers’ season ended with a  in the second round of the 2021 NCAA Tournament.Johnson is a graduate transfer and will be immediately eligible wherever he lands.Prior to participating in the Scarlet Knights’ pregame ceremony on Senior Night, Johnson left the door open to leaving Piscataway, saying that returning to Rutgers was “an option.”“I’m in here, I love it here, I’ve been here for four years,” Johnson said prior to participating in the Scarlet Knights’ Senior Night ceremony. “Rutgers is definitely still an option, it’s never been off the table.”The Long Beach, California, native is coming off the most dominant season for a Rutgers center in a decade.Johnson was one of the best interior defenders in a loaded Big Ten conference, earning  after ranking second in the conference in blocks per game (2.5) and block percentage (10.9%).He led the Big Ten in defensive rebounding percentage, ranked third in effective field goal percentage and fourth in offensive rebounding percentage. Johnson averaged 8.3 points, 8.7 rebounds, 2.5 blocks and 1.1 steals in 24.5 minutes per game.Rutgers is left with a huge hole at center, where  is the lone Scarlet Knight who played significant time at the position last season. - Geo Baker (G) - Ron Harper Jr. (F), Montez Mathis (G), Caleb McConnell (G/F), Mamadou Doucoure (F) - Paul Mulcahy (G), Daniel Lobach (F) - Dean Reiber (F), Oskar Palmquist (F), Mawot Mag (F), Cliff Omoruyi (F), Jaden Jones (G)Note to readers: if you purchase something through one of our affiliate links we may earn a commission.
